bisect - Bisection is the general activity of dividing a geometric figure into two equal parts.
bisection definition: to divide into two usually equal parts.
In geometry, bisection is the division of something into two equal or congruent parts, usually by a line, which is then called a bisector.

wiki.text:
In geometry, 'bisection' is the division of something into two equal or
congruent parts, usually by a line, which is then called a bisector. The most
often considered types of bisectors are the segment bisector (a line that passes
through the midpoint of a given segment) and the angle bisector (a line that
passes through the apex of an angle, that divides it into two equal angles).

In three dimensional space, bisection is usually done by a plane, also called
the bisector or bisecting plane.
